author: UK News
title: New Year’s Eve revellers urged to wrap up warm as temperatures plummet | Shropshire Star
text: The weather is expected to remain unsettled with strong winds, heavy rain and ‘close to freezing’ conditions throughout the last weekend of 2023. New Year’s Eve revellers have been urged to wrap up warm as conditions across many parts of the UK could feel close to freezing as the clock strikes midnight. The weather is expected to remain unsettled with further strong winds and heavy rain throughout the last weekend of 2023. A yellow weather warning for wind covering parts of Wales and the east of England has been issued and will come into force between 11am on Saturday and 3am on Sunday. A spell of strong and gusty winds will move east across England and Wales, bringing some disruption to travel and services, the Met Office said. A yellow weather warning for rain has been issued covering Wales between 10am and 6pm on Saturday, which may lead to flooding and transport disruption. A yellow weather warning for rain will also come into effect at 4am on Saturday for Northern Ireland, due to be in force until 11am the same day. The fresh warnings come on the heels of a gusty few days brought on by Storm Gerrit. Hundreds of homes in Scotland reman without power as the post-storm clean up begins, but electricity bosses are “very confident” that the remaining 750 properties will be reconnected on Friday. Thousands of properties in Ceredigion were without power on Thursday after lightning struck supplies in Wales. The Met Office said its Irish counterpart, Met Eireann, could name another storm – Storm Hank – as a “deep area of low pressure” pushes strong winds across the Republic of Ireland on Saturday. Meteorologist Alex Burkill said Saturday is going to turn “wet and windy” across the UK with a band of “intense rain” pushing its way eastwards and north-eastwards to bring a risk of gales and possibly “severe gales” in exposed spots. In a forecast video, Mr Burkill said northern areas as well as high ground areas in Scotland are likely to see “significant snow”, with possibly 10 to 20cm of snow building up on the highest grounds. “There’s a potential for some snow accumulations, even as low as perhaps 100m up, we could see some slushy snow, so likely to see some travel disruption again, because of the wind, the rain and some snow like we’ve seen over some recent days,” he said. Blustery and showery conditions are set to continue into Sunday, with the heaviest and most frequent rainfall across western parts of the UK. The mercury is expected to drop on Sunday. Mr Burkill said: “As we look towards the end of the day on New Year’s Eve, and the blustery showery theme does continue, some of those showers should start to ease as we head towards midnight. “So perhaps a bit more drier weather around, some clearer skies but do watch out for those showers and you will also want to wrap up quite warm because although it hasn’t been particularly chilly recently, when you factor in those strong blustery winds, it’s going to feel close to freezing for many places. “So definitely a chilly feel to things as the clock strikes midnight.” New Year’s Day should turn drier for many, particularly across more central southern parts of England and across Scotland with the “central slice” of the UK most likely to have showery rain. “As we look through the rest of the first week of 2024 and at the moment Tuesday looks like it’d be a largely dry day with some fine weather around before the return to something more unsettled – some heavy rain, some strong winds, and that does bring the potential for something a little bit colder and possibly wintry,” Mr Burkill said. Three men died after their 4×4 vehicle was submerged in the River Esk, near Glaisdale, on Thursday, North Yorkshire Police said. A “supercell thunderstorm” that moved across the northwest of England on Thursday after a similar storm is thought to have resulted in a tornado that damaged around 100 homes in Stalybridge, in Tameside, Greater Manchester, on Wednesday. Damage will be covered by standard property insurance policies, the Association of British Insurers has said. ScotRail said many lines have been reopened but urged passengers to check for the latest information before travelling, a message echoed by LNER, Avanti West Coast and London Northwestern Railway who suspended or cancelled services due to damage or system faults. Friday will see significant disruption for travellers wishing to travel on the London Euston and Watford Junction lines with services expected to be up and running by the end of the day. In Wales, the aftermath of the recent severe weather will see rail services hampered until Monday.

author: applesun <>
title: 遇见大连
text:
2025年7月23日，星期三，天气多云。
从大连回来两天，赶快来记录一下。
7月21号，我们从大连返回北京，结束了五天的大连之旅。
来大连完全是因为幸运的抢到了刀郎大连演唱会的票。
17号，周四，我们开启了追星之旅。
多多爸下了夜班，吃了饭，我们就打车去北京朝阳站。
这还是我们第一次从朝阳站出发。
去大连的高铁还挺多的，快的3个半小时，慢的5个小时，我们坐的11:14的车，全程4小时34分。
15:48到达大连北，直接换地铁2号线去酒店。
之前想着是18号来，17号是临时决定的，原来的酒店没有房间，就在港湾广场附近临时定了一间房。
出来地铁就是酒店，也算方便。
办了入住，稍做休息，我们先去小船渔村吃晚饭。然后打车去威尼斯水城。
这次出行都是多多做的安排，玩的、住的、吃的……
这座水城以威尼斯为样板，沿岸修建很多欧式建筑，贡多拉船在这些建筑间悠然穿行。晚风轻拂，霓虹闪耀，水巷蜿蜒，滨城的诗情画意，大连的浪漫展现得淋漓尽致。
贡多拉船一个人60元，快速通100一个人，排队的人特别多，我们就看了看，最终也没加入排队大军中。
到大连的第二天，我们早上退了房，换到了中山广场诺富特酒店。
没想到正好有空房，前台就直接给我们办了入住。这次我们订了一个套房，我和多多睡一间，多多爸睡一间。房间挺宽敞，位于36层，视野不错。
本来想18日去棒槌岛，多多查了一下，发现景区发了公告，要设备检修，停业一天。我们只好改变原来的计划，18号去莲花山观景。
我看天气预报，18、19号大连的天气是晴或多云，20、21号有大到暴雨。所以让多多紧着这两天安排。
结果18号上午天也有些阴，我们上了莲花山缆车，刚走了一半就开始下雨，但下的时间不长也不是很大。莲花山缆车有两段，从山下到山顶60元，如果中间不下车，直接翻山到北面是100元。我们就坐到山顶，虽然是背对着海，但回头拍拍照还是可以的，可惜天气不大好。
缆车走到中间的时候，本来该下车的我，工作人员却忘记给我开门了，我直接又往下走了。我回头看到多多和多爸已经下了车，我给他们打去电话，多多爸说已经和工作人员说了，让我直接坐下去，不下车，再转回来。
哎呀，我这还是赚到了。
等我转了一圈，下了缆车，雨已经不怎么下了。
多多买了杯咖啡等着我。
我们登上观光塔，可惜这时候雨不下了，雾上来了，什么也看不到。
往山下走，天也渐渐晴了。远眺跨海大桥，颇为壮观。
一路下山，遇到林间有梅花鹿，或卧在地上休息，或休闲的散步，也有来到路边的，游人就将手里的吃的喂给它们。我们包里正好还剩了几个圣女果，多多就放在手心里，梅花鹿凑上来吃掉了。我们看到有人喂鹿吃挂面，很是好奇，怎么出门还带着挂面呢，后来才发现，有人专门在卖喂鹿的食物，其中就有挂面。
从山上下来，我们打车去了星海广场。星海广场是大连标志性的景点，听说这里有刀郎的应援，我们没找到。这里正在举办啤酒节，晚上还有灯光秀。我们喂了海鸥，拍了拍照，离灯光秀时间还早。多多不想等太久，于是我们又转场到了东港广场，晚上这里有音乐喷泉。音乐喷泉同样很精彩，配上旁边楼上的欢迎刀郎和全国大大小小的灯光，终于找到了一点氛围。如果能配上一首刀郎的歌，就更应景了。
19号，天气还不错，有点晒。 我们睡到自然醒，吃了早饭，去棒槌岛。一路上有些堵车，有一段还禁行。到的时候已经12点了，人特别多，排队坐观光车得排了四五十分钟。
国内几个著名的宾馆中，棒槌岛宾馆就坐落在这里。很多国家领导人都入住这里。
这里三面环山，一面临海，风景怡人。
离海岸几百米远处的海面上有一小岛突兀而立，远远望去，很像农家捣衣服用的一根棒槌，故称棒槌岛。
这里的海滩不像别的地方是柔软的沙子，而是圆润的鹅卵石。
我和多多爸去坐了快艇出海，看到了棒槌岛的后面。岛上岸崖陡峭，怪石嶙峋，遍布着山花野草。
傍晚，我们来到中山广场.
中山广场初建于1899年，是大连历史最悠久的广场，当时称“尼古拉耶夫（沙皇尼古拉二世名字）广场”，日本占领时期改称“大广场”。解放后为纪念孙中山先生，改名为中山广场。
中山广场周围建筑大多是罗马式的、哥特式的、文艺复兴风格等，这些建筑现在大部分被金融机构使用，这里应该也算是大连的金融中心了。
20日，我们来到大连的第四天。我们把出行尽量安排在上午，我们住的地方离体育馆地铁要一个半小时左右的距离，还想着早点去，到外场看看。
上午我们去劳动公园，多多要玩这里的富斯特滑道。然后又去了东关街。东关街是一条历史文化老街，是一个拍照打卡的好地方。不过今天有些闷热，天气预报有有大到暴雨。我们逛了一圈，就回去了。
快三点的时候，外面下起了大雨，还有雷暴蓝色预警。大连文旅也发布了官方通知，如果雨大，将暂停场外活动，并做了详细的疏散安排。
不会这么倒霉吧。
还好，雨下的时间不长，四点的时候雨停了，我们俩打车去了体育馆。到了这边发现，这边的地上干干的，一点雨没下。
看来刀郎还真是有福气，老天爷也在庇佑他演唱会顺利圆满。
21日，我们在大连的最后一天，下午17:11的高铁就要离开这座浪漫美丽的城市了。
上午睡到自然醒，晚上下了雨，早上停了。这两天预报的大暴雨，居然让我们完美的错过了。
吃了早饭，回房间收拾行李，退房、寄存行李，然后去贝壳博物馆逛逛，再去吃个蒸汽海鲜。
完美的行程结束，回家了。
从大连回来两天，赶快来记录一下。

author: Ai-Applications-For-Writi
title: ten Approaches AI Writing Assistants Will Rework Written content Generation
text:
AI composing assistants have revolutionized the content material generation method, providing important assist to writers throughout a variety of industries. These Innovative Laptop or computer courses are intended to support copywriters by supplying creating prompts, strategies, craze identification, and plagiarism checks. Leveraging all-natural language processing (NLP) and facts analysis, AI creating assistants Engage in a pivotal job in enhancing the material development system.
Definition of AI Crafting Assistants
AI composing assistants are complex computer systems that utilize organic language processing to make articles dependant on instructions and data Evaluation from dictionaries and web pages. They offer features for instance grammar checks, information era, rephrasing or rewriting templates, and Search engine optimization-optimized weblog write-up technology.
Great importance of Written content Generation
In today's digital landscape, content material generation is very important for corporations and persons alike. It serves as a powerful Instrument for conveying information, partaking audiences, and driving internet marketing initiatives. Nonetheless, making superior-good quality content continually might be time-consuming and challenging.
Critical Takeaway: The Part of AI Crafting Assistants in Maximizing the Content material Generation Procedure
AI creating assistants Perform an important position in streamlining the content material generation workflow by presenting speedy and productive written content generation, sparking creative imagination by thought technology equipment, and bettering language precision with Innovative grammar and spell checking features. As we delve further in to the intricacies of AI writing assistants, it will become apparent that they keep immense opportunity for transforming how we produce articles.
How Do AI Composing Assistants Get the job done?
AI writing assistants count on all-natural language processing (NLP) algorithms and details Evaluation to boost the articles development procedure. Here's an overview of how these systems perform:
1. All-natural Language Processing (NLP)
NLP is a branch of artificial intelligence that focuses on knowing and analyzing human language. AI crafting assistants employ NLP algorithms to interpret and course of action text, enabling them to supply pertinent recommendations and enhancements to the consumer's producing.
2. Semantic Evaluation
AI creating assistants utilize semantic Assessment approaches to be aware of the that means and context powering written text. By means of semantic analysis, these applications can establish grammatical problems, improve sentence composition, and recommend alternate phrases or phrases that enhance clarity and readability.
three. Grammar and Spell Checking
One among the main capabilities of AI composing assistants is to aid with grammar and spell checking. These applications use NLP algorithms to investigate composed written content, flagging prospective problems such as misspelled words, incorrect verb conjugations, or punctuation faults.
4. Crafting Ideas
AI composing assistants also offer composing suggestions dependant on the analyzed text. By evaluating the enter with large quantities of information from dictionaries, fashion guides, and Websites, these applications can supply tips for bettering sentence move, word decision, or General tone.
5. Facts Evaluation
Knowledge Assessment plays an important position in enhancing the precision and efficiency of AI writing assistants. These resources continually examine consumer interactions and suggestions to improve their suggestions after some time. By leveraging significant datasets, they will learn from designs and trends in an effort to give superior suggestions.
6. Personalization
AI creating assistants generally offer you personalization selections that let people to personalize the tool's strategies dependent on their own distinct requirements or Tastes. This might consist of changing the formality amount of the creating or tailoring tips for different industries or goal audiences.
By combining NLP algorithms with facts Assessment approaches, AI composing assistants can provide important help to information creators, aiding them greatly enhance the standard and efficiency in their composing. These tools offer you An array of characteristics and functionalities designed to streamline the information creation process and Enhance the overall composing experience.
Added benefits and Advantages of Utilizing AI Composing Assistants for Content material Creation
AI writing assistants give a range of Gains and benefits which can noticeably enhance the material creation course of action, making it a lot more economical and powerful. Let us investigate some key advantages of leveraging AI producing assistants for content material creation:
one. Leveraging AI Creating Assistants for Rapid and Productive Material Creation
AI creating assistants allow fast and effective articles development by furnishing worthwhile recommendations, correcting grammar problems, and giving substitute word selections. These instruments can assist in creating content material in a quicker pace, specially when focusing on tight deadlines or handling massive volumes of composing duties. By automating repetitive responsibilities which include proofreading and essential modifying, AI creating assistants free up time for writers to concentrate on more Artistic facets of their function.
2. Sparking Creative imagination with Composing Prompts and Concept Technology Resources
AI crafting assistants can spark creativeness by featuring crafting prompts, concept era applications, and content material templates. These options may help writers get over author's block and create contemporary Suggestions for their content material. How AI Creating Assistants Are Transforming the way in which We Build Content

The Future Landscape of AI Creating Assistants

Anticipating the Continued Evolution

author: @andaluciainf
title: Sánchez afirma haber visto bien a Biden y evidencia su preferencia por él frente a Trump | Andalucía Información. Todas las noticias de Andalucía
text: El jefe del Gobierno español, Pedro Sánchez, aseguró este jueves haber visto bien al presidente de Estados Unidos, Joe Biden, en la cumbre de la OTAN y mostró su preferencia por él frente a Donald Trump, pero remitió a su decisión y a la del Partido Demócrata sobre su candidatura para las próximas elecciones. En la rueda de prensa que ofreció al término de la cumbre de la Alianza y al preguntarle su opinión sobre Biden en medio del debate existente sobre si debe ser o no el candidato demócrata en esos comicios, Sánchez dijo que el presidente estadounidense estuvo presente en todos los debates a diferencia de otros líderes que se ausentaron. "Su compromiso con la OTAN yo creo que es total, es rotundo, y eso se ha demostrado en la celebración de este 75 aniversario", señaló antes de reconocer que no esconde sus preferencias y, "con todos los respetos a lo que vaya a elegir el pueblo estadounidense", prefiere a Biden en vez de a Trump como presidente progresista que es. Pero recalcó que la decisión sobre presentarse finalmente o no depende de él y del Partido Demócrata. Envía tu noticia a: [participa@andaluciainformacion.es](mailto:participa@andaluciainformacion.es)

author: Alice Speri
title: Israel’s War on Gaza After Historic Ruling, Lawyers Vow to Keep Fighting Biden Over Complicity in Gaza Genocide Alice Speri A federal judge dismissed a lawsuit against Biden but implored his administration to reconsider its “unflagging support” for Israel’s war on Gaza.
text:
A federal judge declared on Wednesday that Israel is plausibly engaging in genocide in Gaza and implored the Biden administration to reconsider its “unflagging support” for Israel’s attacks on Palestinians.
The comments came in a ruling in response to a
 lawsuit that accused President Joe Biden and senior administration officials of complicity in and failure to prevent Israel’s genocidal acts, as required by both international and U.S. law. The Center for Constitutional Rights, a nonprofit legal organization, filed the lawsuit on behalf of two Palestinian human rights organizations and Palestinians in Gaza and in the United States.
The judge, Jeffrey S. White of the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California, dismissed the lawsuit on jurisdictional grounds —citing legal doctrine that prevents the judiciary from interfering in matters of foreign policy. But his strong-worded statement is unprecedented, as was his unusual decision to allow more than three hours of testimony from Palestinian plaintiffs during a
powerful hearing last week, including a doctor calling into court from a Gaza hospital hallway.
During that hearing, which took place
ruled that Israel had plausibly engaged in genocide in Gaza, White described the case as the “most difficult” of his career.
“It is every individual’s obligation to confront the current siege in Gaza, but it [is] also this Court’s obligation to remain within the metes and bounds of its jurisdictional scope,” he wrote in his
 decision to dismiss the case. “There are rare cases in which the preferred outcome is inaccessible to the Court. This is one of those cases.”
Justice Department attorneys had asked the judge to dismiss the case on a technicality, citing the jurisdictional question, but did not challenge the suit on its merits. In court last week, government lawyers did not cross-examine witnesses, with the exception of a scholar of the Holocaust who testified that Israel’s actions in Gaza amounted to genocide.
At a press briefing on Thursday afternoon, State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller declined to comment on the lawsuit and the judge’s ruling but said that “it remains our conclusion that the allegations of genocide are unfounded.”
Brad Parker, a senior adviser at Defense for Children International Palestine, one of the two organizational plaintiffs in the case, said that the decision was “disappointing,” but that the judge’s findings — and the fact that such a hearing could take place in a U.S. courtroom in the first place — were of “significant, historic meaning.”
“We know that U.S. weapons are integral in the genocide.”
“We know that U.S. weapons are integral in the genocide that we’re documenting as a Palestinian human rights organization,” Parker told The Intercept. “But similar to the historic ICJ decision and the increasing recognition that what Israel is carrying out is a genocide and the U.S. is complicit in those genocidal acts, I think the strong language from a U.S. federal court judge increasingly works to isolate Israel’s actions and also bring pressure on the Biden administration to change course.”
“It’s clear what President Biden’s complicity is in the destruction of Palestinian life,” Parker added. “And we’re committed to doing everything that we can to end that complicity, and ultimately end the genocide.”
Next Steps
Attorneys for the plaintiffs responded to the ruling by stressing the judge’s “
historic rebuke” of U.S. government support for Israeli crimes. They also disputed the court’s jurisdictional finding, indicating an argument for a potential appeal or request for the case to be reconsidered.
Ahmed Abofoul, a Palestinian attorney at Al Haq, the second organizational plaintiff, testified in court last week about the killing of more than 80 of his relatives since the beginning of the war. During a press conference on Thursday, he said that the dismissal on a technicality “doesn’t mean that this was not a victory.”
“The judge acknowledged that genocide is being committed,” Abpfoul said, “and basically what he was saying is just that his hands are tied.”
Katherine Gallagher, a senior attorney at CCR and
lead counsel on the case, said, “The legal conclusions are there: The U.S. is clearly on notice that its actions are in violation of both international and domestic law.”
In his opinion, White cited an earlier
suit, also brought by CCR, against Caterpillar, the manufacturer that provided the bulldozer used by an Israeli soldier to kill American peace activist Rachel Corrie in Gaza in 2003. That case was also dismissed on the basis that policy decisions are exempt from judicial review, with an appeals court upholding the dismissal. CCR attorneys argued that their case against the Biden administration is different, pledging to explore all legal avenues.
“There is a legal distinction,” Gallagher said during the event on Thursday. The Biden administration’s support for the war in Gaza is more than just “rubber-stamping or approving the use of foreign military financing for a direct commercial sale,” she said. “We have the president of the United States knowing that there is an ongoing genocide and continuing to provide ‘unflagging support’ to Israel.”
Still, Gallagher implied that the lawsuit against Caterpillar could provide a road map for future legal action. “Companies are now on notice because of the ICJ judgment and the U.S. court judgment if they weren’t before, which they should have been. Those companies also have obligations to not further the genocide by continuing to sell and supply weapons that are being used to kill Palestinians every day.”
Join The Conversation

author: Poonam Apraj
title: Mumbai Crime: 50-Year-Old Builder Shot At By Unidentified Assailants In Chembur; Hospitalised With Multiple Bullet Injuries
text: A shocking incident of gunfire took place in Mumbai’s Chembur area on Wednesday night, leaving a 50-year-old builder critically injured. The victim, identified as Sadruddin Khan, a resident of Belapur in Navi Mumbai, was targeted by two unidentified assailants on a motorcycle who opened fire on him near the Sion-Panvel Highway around 9:50 PM. Poonam Apraj Updated: Thursday, April 10, 2025, 02:53 AM IST Sadruddin Khan | File Photo Mumbai: A shocking incident of gunfire took place in Mumbai’s Chembur area on Wednesday night, leaving a 50-year-old builder critically injured. The victim, identified as Sadruddin Khan, a resident of Belapur in Navi Mumbai, was targeted by two unidentified assailants on a motorcycle who opened fire on him near the Sion-Panvel Highway around 9:50 PM. A shocking firing incident was reported near Diamond Garden signal in Chembur on Wednesday night, leaving 50-year-old builder Sadruddin Khan, a resident of Parsik Hill, Belapur, seriously injured. According to Zone 6 DCP Navnath Dhavale, the incident took place around 9:50 PM when Khan was travelling towards Panvel via the Sion-Panvel Highway. Two unidentified men on a motorcycle approached Khan near the signal and opened fire on him before fleeing the scene. Khan was hit by multiple bullets and was rushed to Zen Hospital, where he is currently admitted. His condition is reported to be stable. Chembur Police have registered a case and are scanning CCTV footage from the area to identify and trace the suspects. The motive behind the firing is yet to be determined. Further investigation is underway. FPJ Shorts Mumbai Crime: 50-Year-Old Builder Shot At By Unidentified Assailants In Chembur; Hospitalised With Multiple Bullet Injuries Bombay HC Issues John Doe Order To Halt Sale Of Counterfeit Hindustan Unilever Toothpastes 'Closeup' And 'Pepsodent' Bombay HC Stays MSHRC Order Directing Compensation To Jeweller In Extortion Case Against Policemen Badlapur Sexual Assault Case: Bombay HC Slams Maharashtra Govt For Delay In Child Safety Measures According to police sources, Khan was en route to Panvel when the attackers approached and fired 4–5 rounds at him. He sustained serious injuries and was immediately rushed to Zen Hospital, where he is currently under treatment and reported to be in a stable condition. Read Also Navi Mumbai Crime: Ex-Shiv Sena Corporator Booked For Rape, Paternity Denial And Caste Abuse The Chembur police have initiated an investigation into the matter. CCTV footage from the area is being examined to identify the assailants and trace their route. A case has been registered, and police teams have launched a manhunt to nab the culprits. Motive behind the attack is yet to be ascertained. Further investigation is underway.

author: bloodhorse
title: Churchill Decides to Scrap Turf Racing in September - BloodHorse
text: Reversing plans to use its troubled turf course during its September Meet, [Churchill Downs](https://www.bloodhorse.com/horse-racing/racetracks/10/churchill-downs) now will race strictly on dirt during its upcoming season Sept. 12-29, according to Darren Rogers, the track's senior director of communications and media services. Rogers previously told BloodHorse July 17 that the track still intended to race in September on its turf, though such use seemed optimistic after the course turned brown and unsightly in early July after postmeet work on it that included scalping, aeration, and the sprigging and fertilization of Bermuda grass. The track's $10 million turf course, installed with sod in the fall of 2021, began experiencing problems after regular usage shortly after its debut for racing in the spring of 2022. The track ran only 20 turf races apiece during its September and fall meets of last year, but after winter and spring maintenance was performed, Churchill was able to race over it through its spring meet this year, though it showed wear and tear. Seventy-four turf races were run on grass during this past meet April 27-June 30. Explaining the decision to scrap turf racing in September, Rogers said July 25 that the Churchill Downs team met and "They just wanted it to have a little more time, let it be at its maximum for the start of the fall meet" from Oct. 27-Dec. 1. He noted that Kentucky horses have opportunities to race on grass at [Ellis Park](https://www.bloodhorse.com/horse-racing/racetracks/47/ellis-park) and at the all-turf track, [Kentucky Downs](https://www.bloodhorse.com/horse-racing/racetracks/68/kentucky-downs), immediately before the Churchill Downs September Meet and then following it when [Keeneland](https://www.bloodhorse.com/horse-racing/racetracks/1/keeneland) runs in October. The condition book for the September Meet, likely to be released next week, will not have any turf races offered. The track had planned only one grass stakes race, the $200,000, one-mile Jefferson Cup for 3-year-olds Sept. 28, which will go on hiatus this year so as to not conflict with the Sept. 21 Bourbon Flight (formerly the Bourbon Trail) for 3-year-olds at 1 3/16 miles, the track's vice president of racing and racing secretary Ben Huffman indicated. To date, Churchill has opted not to entirely seed a new course from scratch. Having a race-ready turf course is of prime importance to the Louisville, Ky., track when it stages Kentucky Derby (G1) week in late April and early May. This year, Derby week handle was a record $446.6 million, up 8% from last year's previous record of $412 million.

author: Yahoo TV UK
title: Met Office warns of 75mph winds across UK ahead of New Year celebrations
text:
The Telegraph Met Office warns of 75mph winds across UK ahead of New Year celebrations Read full article India McTaggart 29 December 2023 at 2:06 pm · 2-min read The Met Office warning comes as the Environment Agency issued more flood warnings after areas like Tewkesbury (pictured) badly hit by Storm Gerrit braced for more rainfall - Emma Trimble / SWNS
The Met Office has warned that gusts of 75mph could hit parts of the south of England and Wales this weekend.
The yellow weather warning covers parts of the South East, South West, East Anglia and Wales from 11am on Saturday until 3am on December 31.
A separate yellow warning has been issued for Northern Ireland from midnight until 11am on Saturday, with up to 25mm of rain expected in just a few hours.
It comes as the Environment Agency (EA) issued 23 flood warnings and a further 103 flood alerts after areas badly hit by Storm Gerrit braced for yet more rainfall.
The flood warnings cover areas near Cheltenham, Rugby, Oswestry, York and the Lake District.
Members of the Knottingley Canoe Club visited the River Ouse, York to take advantage of the rising flood water following heavy rain from Storm Gerrit - Yorkshire Post / SWNS Storm Gerrit battered much of the country over the week with 80mph winds, blizzards and heavy rain, leaving some in Scotland claiming they were blindsided by its ferocity .
In the storm’s wake, the Met Office has pledged to review its weather alerts after it has been challenged over whether amber alerts should have been issued.
Hundreds of homes in Scotland remain without power as the post-storm clean-up begins, but electricity bosses are “very confident” the remaining 750 properties will be reconnected on Friday.
Thousands of properties in Ceredigion were also without power on Thursday after lightning struck supplies in Wales.
Meanwhile, New Year’s Eve revellers have been urged to wrap up as conditions across many parts of the UK could feel close to freezing on Sunday night.
People have been urged to travel before the New Year weekend as rail chaos continues across the country - Vuk Valcic / Avalon Meteorologist Alex Burkill warned there will be a “chilly feel to things as the clock strikes midnight”.
The weather is expected to remain unsettled with further strong winds and heavy rain throughout the last weekend of 2023.
The Met Office said a spell of strong and gusty winds will move east across England and Wales, bringing some disruption to travel and services.
It comes as people have been urged to travel as early as Friday to avoid missing the festivities as rail chaos continues across the country .
TRENDING Davina McCall stormed off Masked Singer after close friend was unmasked Yahoo TV UK · 2-min read Tractor driver who tried to save three men stuck in 4x4 says they were ‘swept away’ by River Esk The Independent · 2-min read Wealthy businessman who secretly filmed himself having sex with woman has to pay £500 in damages The Telegraph · 3-min read Protest at Catholic girls school a sign of ‘deeper malaise’ in Northern Ireland PA Media: UK News · 4-min read Putin sends revenge squads into Crimea after destruction of warship The Telegraph · 3-min read
